intro: Fagara ocumarensis, commonly known as the Ocuma fern, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
